channel.title: ScapeRune #462 - Bringing back what you loved, piece by piece!
channel.description:
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/wli4Z8k.gif[/img]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/JQXN1Ev.png[/img] [table][tr][td][pre] [/pre][/td][td] [table][tr][td][pre] [/pre][/td][td]
[COLOR=#96A0FF]ScapeRune is a very well known RuneScape emulator from the OSRemake Team built from scratch using raw NIO. Our server is the first RSPS in history known to create minimum garbage, which results in steady cycle times (Averaging .4ms) and memory usage under 30MB with 2,000 players (While still loading all data from the cache). It is based on the #462 cache, which dates back to the middle of Summer 2007 ([B][U]July 4th, 2007[/U][/B]). I believe that RuneScape played a very big part in all of our Summers of 2007, and that this era will give players enough content to keep things stirred up while still maintaining that nostalgic feel that's often sought after. We are the first and only #462 server in RSPS history, setting us apart from the rest. For those of you unfamiliar with this era, it is the last revision before items kept on death, while still including the game and interface engine update. It is loaded with lots of memorable features such as Construction, Hunter, Warriors Guild, Stronghold Of Security, Lunar Diplomacy, Barbarian Assault, and many more. Due to Jagex ruining their 2007 servers and letting things get out of hand, it's time to give the real veteran players somewhere they can call home. I bring to you, ScapeRune #462.[/td][/tr][/table][/td][/tr][/table]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/UjW9XjA.png[/img] [table][tr][td][pre] [/pre][/td][td]

[/td][/tr][/table]

Recently updated the thread with two more videos to highlight our progress. Lots of unique development is in the works this week including nostalgic random events that have never been seen before in a RSPS! Thanks for all of the support and keep a look out ;).

item.title: ScapeRune #462 - Bringing back what you loved, piece by piece!
item.dc:creator: @Thing1 Thing1
item.description:
@Thing1 wrote:

[COLOR=#000]The ScapeRune Team has been hard at work this September and progress is as phenomenal as ever. Many have been wondering what has been happening over this last month, and we hope this will shine some light upon our work. Most development has been happening behind the scenes, but there are still plenty of major game updates and information listed below to read about. We hope this will wrap up the month of September on a positive note!

[U][B]Staff Updates:[/B][/U]
[table][tr][td][pre] [/pre][/td][td]
[B]Mod Michael[/B] - As some of you may be aware of, Mod Michael has been going through some personal problems lately and has remained inactive. Recently, he confronted the team confirming that he has lost his interest and will be leaving the ScapeRune family. While we are all quite sad to have lost a great asset, please don’t fear! We have made arrangements to get a suitable replacement to keep development at progressive speeds.

[B]Mod Nomac[/B] - Mod Nomac will be taking over Mod Michael’s position. He has been in the remake scene for years and is well known upon us developers. Some of you may recognize him from developing content in a previous version of OSRemake (now ScapeRune) and already know that this will be a more than appropriate decision. He has a vast love for this project and will go above and beyond to help ScapeRune succeed.
[/td][/tr][/table]

[B]Quest Updates:[/B]

[ul][][COLOR=green]Black Knights’ Fortress[/COLOR]
[][COLOR=green]Cook’s Assistant[/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=orange]Demon Slayer[/COLOR][/ul]

[U][B]Skill Updates:[/B][/U]

[ul][][COLOR=green]Crafting[/COLOR]
[][COLOR=green]Cooking[/COLOR]
[][COLOR=orange]Smithing[/COLOR]
[][COLOR=orange]Prayer[/COLOR][/ul]

[U][B]Quest Media:[/B][/U]
[table][tr][td][pre] [/pre][/td][td]https://youtu.be/ZAwteyfIDUc[/td][/tr][/table]
[table][tr][td][pre] [/pre][/td][td]https://youtu.be/O6lILY6_4rc[/td][/tr][/table]

With October just right around the corner, we hope you are ready for yet another action packed month. Trust us, you wont want to miss this!

Read full topic
